list_definition.definition: a wine cup, especially one used in religious services

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The priest offers the communion bread and the deacon offers the chalice.

list_ex_of_english: He worked on designs of altars, candelsticks, chalices, and lamps for churches.
Much of the building was destroyed and many effects, costly books, chalices and vestments were lost.
We are being asked to drink from a poisoned chalice, and then carry out a foul deed in a state of some intoxication.
I do not believe that my statement will be seen as a poisoned chalice.
Vestments were still hidden, golden candlesticks bequeathed, chalices kept.
The items, which included chalices and patens, were taken from the college chapel while it was open to the public.
What a poisoned chalice this post will prove to be to the unfortunate holder!
Chalice's logo is a mix of the form of a goblet and the blossom of the opium flower.
